subject: Design
title: The Suburban Living Room: TV Changes Everything
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The Suburban Living Room: TV Changes Everything.

hook.text: Before TV, furniture faced each other for conversation. After TV, everything faced the screen.

buildup.text: The 1950s suburban boom created millions of identical living rooms oriented around a television set.

discovery.text: TV didn't just enter the room â€” it redesigned the room. Sofas, chairs, and lighting all reoriented.

twist.text: The fireplace, once the focal point of every room for millennia, was dethroned by a glowing box.

climax.text: One technology fundamentally altered the layout of billions of living rooms worldwide.

punchline.text: Technology doesn't just fill rooms. It rearranges them.

quiz.question: How did television change living room design?
options: Reoriented all furniture to face the screen
